Description: THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT CONSERVATION AND CO-MANAGEMENT OF THE MARINE MAMMAL SUBSISTENCE USE BY ALASKA NATIVES, SPECIFICALLY THOSE LIVING IN THE ALEUT MARINE MAMMAL COMMISSION REGION TO INCREASE AWARENESS OF CO-MANAGEMENT BY IMPROVING THE UNDERSTANDING OF THE SPECIES AND TO PROMOTE CONSERVATION, RESEARCH, AND MANAGEMENT NEEDS AND ACTIVITIES FOR A MORE EDUCATED USER WHO IS CULTURALLY IN TUNE TO THE SUBSISTENCE USES OF MARINE MAMMALS BY ALASKA NATIVES.

PROJECT OBJECTIVES: 1. TO CONTRIBUTE TO STRANDING NETWORK OPERATIONS IN NEW ENGLAND BY CONTINUING AND RESTORING CAPACITY OF THE REHABILITATION PROGRAM FOR LIVE-STRANDED PINNIPEDS AT THE NATIONAL MARINE LIFE CENTER; 2. TO ENHANCE EFFICIENCY OF DATA MANAGEMENT AND DATA SHARING OF LEVEL B AND C DATA THROUGH FURTHER DATABASE DEVELOPMENT; 3. TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY, CONSISTENCY, REPORTING, AND SHARING OF LEVEL B AND C DATA COLLECTED FROM STRANDED MARINE MAMMALS THROUGH STAFFING, TRAINING, DIAGNOSTIC SAMPLING, AND HISTOPATHOLOGY.

PROJECT OBJECTIVES: ACCEPT MARINE MAMMAL PARASITES AND PARASITIC LESIONS FROM NOAA APPROVED SOURCES AND PREPARE A REPORT TO THE SUBMITTING ORGANIZATION IDENTIFYING THE PARASITES AND THEIR SIGNIFICANCE. DOCUMENT AND RECORD THE TYPES AND RELEVANCE OF PARASITES TO MARINE MAMMAL HEALTH AND STRANDINGS. ESTABLISH COMMON PARASITES FROM MARINE MAMMAL HOSTS. ENHANCE DATA ANALYSIS AND FORM COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS TO AUGMENT PUBLICATION OF RESULTS.

PROJECT OBJECTIVES:   TO HELP SUPPORT THE NEW YORK MARINE RESCUE CENTER (NYMRC) CURRENT RESCUE AND REHABILITATION PROGRAM. TO HELP ASSIST WITH THE NECESSARY RESOURCES NEEDED FOR COLLECTING, REPORTING, AND SHARING OF DATA FROM STRANDED MARINE MAMMAL IN NEW YORK STATE (NYS). IN ADDITION, COLLECTION AND MAINTENANCE OF BASELINE DATA IDENTIFYING HUMAN INTERACTIONS AND FISHERIES INTERACTIONS, HABITAT THREATS AND OTHER THREATS TO PINNIPED SPECIES. ELEVATE THE PROFILE AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF NYMRC THROUGH ENHANCED PARTICIPATION IN TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES, CONFERENCES AND WORKSHOPS BY STAFF AND FACILITY VOLUNTEERS/INTERNS. THE PROJECT OBJECTIVE(S) IS TO PROVIDE STRANDING RESPONSE FOR THE SOUTH CAROLINA MARINE MAMMAL STRANDING NETWORK (SCMMSN) AND INCREASE AWARENESS ABOUT MARINE MAMMALS IN SOUTH CAROLINA. THE OBJECTIVES IN THIS PROPOSAL WILL BE EXECUTED BY LMMN IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE'S HOLLINGS MARINE LABORATORY (NOS/HML). FUNDING IS REQUESTED FOR LMMN FOR: (1) PERSONNEL AND LOGISTICS REQUIRED FOR STRANDING RESPONSE, TISSUE COLLECTION, AND EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH.

PROJECT OBJECTIVES: THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO IMPROVE THE RESPONSE TO AND WELFARE OF STRANDED CETACEANS IN THE NETWORK. THE FOLLOWING PROJECT OBJECTIVES REPRESENT CRITICAL STEPS TOWARDS ACHIEVING THIS GOAL: 1. PROVIDE HANDS-ON LIVE STRANDED CETACEAN TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES TO A MINIMUM OF 10 VISITING GREATER ATLANTIC REGION NETWORK MEMBERS IN THE FIELD AND AT THE CETACEAN INTENSIVE CARE UNIT. 2. IMPROVE CARE OF AND DISPOSITION DECISIONS FOR 5 LIVE STRANDED CETACEANS THAT ARE BORDERLINE RELEASE CANDIDATES AT THE CETACEAN INTENSIVE CARE UNIT. 3. INCREASE NETWORK CAPACITY TO RESPOND TO CETACEAN STRANDINGS THROUGH A MULTIFACETED APPROACH TO KNOWLEDGE SHARING AND COLLABORATION WITH A MINIMUM OF 10 STRANDING NETWORK AGENCIES.

THE LAST SURVIVING SPECIES IN ITS GENUS, HAWAIIAN MONK SEALS (NEOMONACHUS SCHAUINSLANDI / `ILIO HOLO I KA UAUA) ARE ENDEMIC TO THE HAWAIIAN ARCHIPELAGO, AND ONE OF THE MOST ENDANGERED SEAL SPECIES IN THE WORLD. RECENT SCIENCE HAS SHOWN THAT THE POPULATION HAS BEEN GROWING INCREMENTALLY OVER THE LAST TEN YEARS AND THAT CURRENT CONSERVATION INTERVENTIONS ARE A PART OF THIS GROWTH. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT THE CONTINUATION OF THESE INTERVENTIONS AND PROMOTE THE SURVIVAL AND RECOVERY OF THE SPECIES.

CLEARWATER MARINE AQUARIUM (CMA) AIMS TO UPGRADE ITS NECROPSY TRAILER AND CARCASS RECOVERY PRACTICES TO INCREASE HUMAN SAFETY, IMPROVE RESPONSE EFFICIENCY, AND ADVANCE NECROPSY SAMPLING CAPABILITIES. ADDITIONAL OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE INCREASED RESOURCES AND SKILLED PERSONNEL CAPABLE OF THOROUGH NECROPSIES, WHICH ENHANCES THE NETWORK'S CAPABILITIES DURING MASS STRANDINGS AND UMES; PROTECTION OF PERSONNEL AND RESOURCES BY MITIGATING LOSS AND INJURY; IMPROVED CAPACITY TO SUPPORT NOAA-PERMITTED RESEARCHERS THROUGH PROPER SAMPLE STORAGE; AND ENHANCED DATA COLLECTION TO SUPPORT EMERGING DISEASE AND CAUSE OF DEATH INVESTIGATIONS.

PROJECT OBJECTIVES:  - SUPPORT ESSENTIAL STAFFING TO MAINTAIN THE STRANDING RESPONSE PROGRAM IN DELAWARE BY FUNDING THE CRITICAL ROLE OF THE STRANDING COORDINATOR'S POSITION AND THE POSITION OF THE STRANDING TECHNICIAN.  THESE ROLES ENABLE THE STRANDING PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN ITS STRANDING RESPONSE CAPACITY, WHILE INCREASING CAPACITY FOR SEAL RESPONSE, TRIAGE AND RESEARCH. - STRUCTURED AND COORDINATED SEAL RESEARCH AND SURVEILLANCE MONITORING OF THE SEASONAL GRAY SEAL COLONY AND THE EMERGING TREND OF SEAL PUPPING WILL CONTRIBUTE TO GREATER UNDERSTANDING OF BEHAVIORS, HEALTH PARAMETERS, POPULATION, IDENTIFICATION OF INDIVIDUALS IN THE COLONY, AND GEOSPATIAL DATA. - SUPPORT THE COST OF THE 24-HOUR REPORTING HOTLINE AND CELL PHONE COVERAGE, WHICH WILL FACILITATE COMMUNICATION DURING STRANDING EVENTS AND GENERAL OPERATIONS.  - EDUCATION AND OUTREACH EFFORTS WILL PROMOTE MESSAGING REGARDING SEALS IN HUMAN USE AREAS AND SCARCITY OF REHABILITATION RESOURCES, PROMOTION OF THE 24-HOUR HOTLINE,

OBJECTIVE: THIS PROPOSAL HAS TWO OBJECTIVES: 1. TO SUSTAIN MOTE MARINE LABORATORY'S HIGH LEVEL OF RESPONSE TO LIVE AND DEAD STRANDINGS THROUGH PARTIAL SUPPORT OF STAFF AND SUPPLIES. 2. ENHANCE THE ABILITY TO EVALUATE STRANDED CETACEANS FOR INJURIES THROUGH THE USE OF ALTERNATIVE LIGHT IMAGERY (ALI).

CONTINUED DOCUMENTATION OF INFECTIOUS DISEASES, PARASITES, AND DETERMINATION OF PROBABLE CAUSE OF MORTALITY. EMPLOY THE USE OF UNMANNED AERIAL SYSTEMS TO ENHANCE DETECTION OF ENTANGLED PINNIPEDS AND AID IN DISENTANGLEMENT EFFORTS. REORGANIZATION OF STAFF AND VOLUNTEER STRUCTURE TO FACILITATE INCREASED COVERAGE WHILE IMPROVING DOCUMENTATION OF REPORTS AND STRANDINGS. DISSEMINATING FINDINGS BY PUBLISHING IN PEER-REVIEWED JOURNALS AND PRESENTING AT REGIONAL CONFERENCES. CONTINUED EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC THROUGH INCREASED OUTREACH EFFORTS. CONTINUED COLLABORATION WITH THE DORIS DUKE CONSERVATION SCHOLARS PROGRAM THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES TO MINORITY GROUPS THAT HAVE HISTORICALLY BEEN UNDERREPRESENTED IN STEM. RESTRUCTURING OF RESPONSE PROCEDURES WITH SAN JUAN COUNTY AND ISLANDS OIL SPILL ASSOCIATION TO SEIZE ON THE INSIGHT GAINED FROM A RECENT HAZARDOUS MATERIAL SPILL INCIDENT, TO REINFORCE PREPAREDNESS FOR ANY FUTURE EVENTS IN OUR REGION.

THE OVERALL GOAL OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE THE SERVICE OF RESCUE AND REHABILITATION OF STRANDED MARINE MAMMALS WITHIN THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY, UTILIZING THE STAFF, FACILITIES, AND EQUIPMENT OF THE MARINE MAMMAL STRANDING CENTER OF BRIGANTINE. SPECIFICALLY, THIS WILL INCLUDE: 1) SUPPORT AND ENHANCE THE BASIC NEEDS AND FACILITY OPERATIONS DIRECTLY RELATED TO THE RESPONSE, CARE, TREATMENT, AND DATA COLLECTION FROM LIVING AND DEAD STRANDED MARINE MAMMALS. 2) ENHANCEMENTS TO THE REHABILITATION FACILITIES AND RECORDKEEPING SYSTEMS TO EXCEED NMFS STANDARDS FOR REHABILITATION FACILITIES. 3) INCREASE COLLABORATION WITH STATE AND LOCAL AGENCIES THROUGH FIRST RESPONDER TRAINING WORKSHOPS, AND ENHANCE COMMUNITY OUTREACH EFFORTS IN NEW JERSEY FOCUSED ON INCREASING AWARENESS AND PREVENTING HUMAN INTERACTIONS WITH PINNIPEDS.

PROJECT OBJECTIVES: LEPTOSPIRA HAS CAUSED REGULAR OUTBREAKS IN CALIFORNIA SEA LIONS (ZALOPHUS CALIFORNIANUS), AND HAS BEEN A MAJOR CAUSE OF STRANDING FOR THIS SPECIES. HOWEVER, EVIDENCE ALSO EXISTS OF LEPTOSPIRA INFECTION IN A RANGE OF OTHER MARINE MAMMAL SPECIES. THUS, OUR STUDY AIMS TO ADVANCE UNDERSTANDING OF CIRCULATION PATTERNS AND HEALTH IMPACTS OF LEPTOSPIRA IN ALL MARINE MAMMALS OF THE EASTERN PACIFIC OCEAN BY CAPITALIZING ON NEWLY AVAILABLE GENOMIC TECHNIQUES. SPECIFICALLY, WE SEEK TO ADDRESS LONGSTANDING QUESTIONS OF HOW MANY DIFFERENT MARINE MAMMAL SPECIES ARE INFECTED BY LEPTOSPIRA, WHETHER INFECTING STRAINS ARE SIMILAR (REPRESENTING A COMMON SOURCE OF LEPTOSPIRA, OR CIRCULATION OF A SHARED STRAIN AND EPIDEMIOLOGICAL LINKAGES) OR ARE GENETICALLY DISTINCT FROM ONE ANOTHER (REPRESENTING SEPARATE SOURCES AND TRANSMISSION CYCLES), AND WHETHER THE INFECTIONS CAN CAUSE MEASURABLE HEALTH IMPACTS. WE PLAN TO ACHIEVE OUR GOALS THROUGH ADDRESSING THE FOLLOWING SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES: O
CONTINUE BUILDING WDC'S CAPACITY TO SUPPORT ALL RAPID RESPONSES AND INVESTIGATIONS AS OUTLINED IN THE STRANDING AGREEMENT (INCLUDING AN EXPANDED STRANDING COVERAGE AREA).

TO MAINTAIN MARINE MAMMAL STRANDING RESPONSE IN DOWNEAST MAINE THROUGH CONTINUED EMPLOYMENT OF KEY RESPONSE PERSONNEL AND PURCHASE OF SUPPLIES, THUS ENABLING AN EFFECTIVE AND HUMANE SCIENCE-BASED PROGRAM THAT INCLUDES RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT, TRAINING, DATA COLLECTION AND EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH.

PROVIDE ADDITIONAL TRAINING OF GROUPS OUT ON THE WATERS INCLUDING WDFW TEAMS AND THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST WHALE WATCH ASSOCIATION 3. ELEVATE THE ENTANGLEMENT RESPONSE STATUS OF A NUMBER OF KEY PERSONNEL 4. FOLLOW UP EFFORT TO DOCUMENT WHALES POST ENTANGLEMENT RESPONSE EFFORTS 5. SURVEYS WITH RESPONSE-READY CREWS INTO AREAS OF HIGH ENTANGLEMENT RISK OR ANIMALS OUT OF HABITAT IN POTENTIAL ENTANGLEMENT RISK AREAS.

PROJECT OBJECTIVES: 1) PROVIDE CONSISTENT, THOROUGH, AND EFFICIENT RESPONSE TO ALL MARINE MAMMAL SPECIES IN OUR PRIMARY RESPONSE AREAS (INCLUDING COMPLETE NECROPSY WHERE FEASIBLE) AND LARGE WHALES THROUGHOUT WASHINGTON STATE. 2) DETERMINE IF STRANDINGS ARE UNDERREPORTED TO THE NETWORK VIA BEACH SURVEYS AND INATURALIST SEARCHES. 3) ASSESS THE FREQUENCY AND IMPACTS OF HARASSMENT ON HARBOR SEALS THAT UTILIZE HAUL OUT SITES AT OR NEAR MARINAS DURING PUPPING SEASON. 4) PROVIDE TRAININGS FOR STAFF OF STATE AND NATIONAL PARKS ON THE WASHINGTON OUTER COAST TO ENHANCE REPORTING AND ALLOW FOR QUICKER RESPONSE TO STRANDED MARINE MAMMALS

ENHANCE THE QUALITY, QUANTITY AND SHARING OF LEVEL A, B, AND C DATA COLLECTED FROM STRANDED MARINE MAMMALS, PROVIDE POST-UNUSUAL MORTALITY EVENT (UME) SURVEILLANCE IN AN AREA OF REPEATED UMES (INDIAN RIVER LAGOON, 2001, 2008, 2013; MID ATLANTIC 2013-2015) AND ENHANCE DATA COLLECTION, DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSES, AND THE DETECTION/REPORTING OF EMERGING DISEASES. STRENGTHEN LIVE ANIMAL RESPONSE CAPABILITIES, AND PREPAREDNESS FOR THE DISENTANGLEMENT AND MONITORING OF FREE-SWIMMING SMALL CETACEANS. INCREASE COLLABORATION WITH STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT ORGANIZATIONS THROUGH TRAINING AND OUTREACH DEVELOPMENT TO ENHANCE THE DETECTION OF STRANDING EVENTS AND YIELD A MORE EFFECTIVE RESPONSE.

PROJECT OBJECTIVES: THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT ARE AS FOLLOWS: 1. SUPPORT OUTREACH AND EDUCATION TO INFORM PUBLIC EXPECTATIONS SURROUNDING LARGE WHALE STRANDING AND NECROPSY RESPONSE. 4. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CHARACTERIZE THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN REHABILITATION AND ANTIMICROBIAL RESISTANCE IN STRANDED WEANED NORTHERN ELEPHANT SEAL PUPS. SPECIFIC PROJECT OBJECTIVES INCLUDE: TO QUANTIFY ANTIMICROBIAL RESISTANCE, BOTH THROUGH THE PRESENCE OF GENES AND RESISTANCE CONFERRED TO COLIFORM BACTERIA, FOUND WITHIN STRANDED WEANED ELEPHANT SEAL PUPS UPON ADMISSION TO THE HOSPITAL; TO ASSESS CHANGES IN PATTERNS OF ANTIMICROBIAL RESISTANCE IN STRANDED WEANED ELEPHANT SEAL PUPS THROUGHOUT REHABILITATION; TO COMPARE PATTERNS OF ANTIMICROBIAL RESISTANCE IN STRANDED WEANED ELEPHANT SEAL PUPS WITH THOSE OF FREE RANGING ELEPHANT SEAL PUPS THROUGHOUT THE POST-WEANING PERIOD.

THIS PROPOSAL ENCOMPASSES COSTS AND MATCHES FOR PERSONNEL, SUPPLIES, AND EQUIPMENT TO FACILITATE RESPONSE TO, TREATMENT OF, AND DATA COLLECTION FROM LIVING AND DEAD STRANDED MARINE MAMMALS FOUND IN ALL SECTIONS OF THE OREGON COAST. PROPOSED ACTIVITIES INCLUDE CONTINUED INVESTIGATIONS OF DEAD ANIMALS TO INCLUDE DIAGNOSTICS AND TISSUE ARCHIVING, CONTINUED RESPONSE TO ENTANGLED LIVE PINNIPEDS AND WHALES, CONTINUED RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING OF VOLUNTEER GROUPS, WORKSHOPS TO INCREASE THE LEVEL A, B AND C DATA COLLECTION CAPABILITIES OF PRIMARY RESPONDERS, AND FURTHER DEVELOPMENT OF A STATEWIDE STRANDING DATABASE THAT IS COMPATIBLE WITH REGIONAL AND NATIONAL DATABASES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE CONTINUED INCREASES IN THE EFFICIENCY, EFFECTIVENESS AND COHESIVENESS OF THE OREGON MARINE MAMMAL STRANDING NETWORK AND CONTINUED PROGRESS IN ESTABLISHING BASELINES IN MARINE MAMMAL MORTALITY AND MORBIDITY PATTERNS AND SURVEILLANCE OF EMERGING DISEASES.
THESE FUNDS WILL IMPROVE OUR ABILITY TO PERFORM NECROPSIES SAFELY AND GIVE US GREATER CAPABILITY TO STORE ARCHIVED SAMPLES FOR CURRENT AND FUTURE RESEARCH PROJECTS.

SUPPORT FOR THE OCEAN ANIMAL RESPONSE AND RESEARCH ALLIANCE (OARRA) TO CONTINUE THE DEVELOPMENT OF A DEDICATED RESPONSE TO EXAMINE AND COLLECT LEVEL A, B, AND C DATA ON DEAD-STRANDED AND FLOATING MARINE ANIMALS IN LOS ANGELES COUNTY. CONTINUE TO BUILD A DIVERSE EQUITABLE, ACCESSIBLE, AND INCLUSIVE FIRST RESPONSE TEAM AND INTERNSHIP PROGRAM THAT IS CRITICAL TO OARRA'S COMMITMENT TO ADOPT EQUITABLE BEHAVIORS THAT WILL FUEL COMMUNICATION, COLLABORATION, INNOVATION, AND CREATIVITY WITH OUR NETWORK PARTICIPANTS AS WE DELIVER ON OUR MISSION.

PROJECT OBJECTIVES: THIS PROPOSAL REQUESTS FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE WASHINGTON DEPARTMENT OF FISH & WILDLIFE'S ONGOING MARINE MAMMAL STRANDING PROGRAM AND ASSOCIATED ACTIVITIES. THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE TO: 1) PROVIDE LIVE STRANDING RESPONSES AND TRIAGE, REQUIRING SKILLED EXPERTISE IN LIVE ANIMAL HANDLING INCLUDING ANIMALS OUT OF HABITAT, OIL SPILLS, ENTANGLEMENT RESPONSES, UMES, MASS STRANDINGS, AND OTHER PRIORITY EVENTS REQUIRING INTERVENTIONS; 2) CONDUCT THOROUGH NECROPSIES OF FRESH DEAD ANIMALS TO ASSESS CAUSES OF MORTALITY INCLUDING HUMAN INTERACTIONS, DISEASE, AND OTHER CAUSES; 3) EVALUATE THE INCIDENCE AND IMPACT OF EMERGING DISEASES THAT MAY INCREASE MORTALITY OR INCREASE HEALTH RISKS TO MARINE MAMMALS; 4) INCREASE COMMUNICATION WITH OTHER AGENCIES, MEDIA, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC REGARDING MARINE MAMMAL STRANDING INVESTIGATIONS; 5) CONTINUING PARTICIPATION, COMMUNICATION, COORDINATION WITHIN THE WEST COAST MARINE MAMMAL STRANDING NETWORK; 6) ATTEND MEETINGS A

PROJECT OBJECTIVES: THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO CONTINUE TO ENHANCE THE QUALITY, CONSISTENCY, QUANTITY, REPORTING AND SHARING OF LEVEL A, B, AND C DATA COLLECTED FROM STRANDED MARINE MAMMALS BY COMPLETING DIAGNOSTIC SCREENING, COLLECTING, AND ANALYZING SAMPLES AND SCIENTIFIC DATA, AND DETECTING AND REPORTING EMERGING DISEASES, NEW LESIONS, OR UNCOMMON FINDINGS FROM DEAD STRANDED MARINE MAMMALS IN MARYLAND. PROJECT OBJECTIVES: JENNETTE'S PIER WISHES TO CREATE A PERMANENT POSITION WITHIN OUR ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO MARINE MAMMAL STRANDING RESPONSE ON THE OUTER BANKS OF NC. DUE TO DECREASED CAPACITY FROM NCWRC IN THE NORTHERN DISTRICT, JENNETTE'S PIER HAS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING ADDITIONAL COVERAGE TO THE VIRGINIA STATE BORDER AND ESTABLISHING A TRAINED, DEPENDABLE VOLUNTEER CORP. THIS POSITION WILL PREVENT A REGIONAL COVERAGE GAP WHILE ALLOWING THE PIER TO BUILD LONG-TERM CAPACITY TO SUPPORT THE OUTER BANKS MARINE MAMMAL STRANDING NETWORK. SUPPORT FROM PRESCOTT FUNDS WOULD ALLOW JENNETTE'S PIER TO ESTABLISH THE POSITION AND SALARY WITHIN THE ORGANIZATION UNTIL IT CAN PERMANENTLY ADD IT TO ITS OPERATIONAL BUDGET. THIS PROPOSED POSITION WILL WORK WITH REGIONAL PARTNERS TO COORDINATE RESPONSE EFFORTS FROM NAGS HEAD, NC, NORTH TO THE VA BORDER, MANAGE AND MAINTAIN AN INVENTORY OF RESPONSE SUPPLIES AND EQUIPMENT, AND WORK TO INCREASE OUR CAPACITY TO RESPOND BY ESTABLISHING, RECRUITING, AND TRA

TO MAINTAIN STAFF AND FACILITY'S ABILITY TO ADMIT, CARE FOR AND RELEASE (WHEN APPLICABLE) MARINE MAMMALS IN ALASKA AND ASSIST IN STRANDING EVENTS. THROUGH MONITORING STRANDED PATIENTS, TO TEST FOR DISEASES AND EFFECTS OF WARMING OCEAN CONDITIONS IN ALASKA. TO EXPAND CAPABILITY TO RESPOND TO LIVE STRANDINGS IN RURAL ALASKA BY TRAINING LOCAL PROFESSIONALS.

THE GOALS OF THIS PROJECT ARE TO ENHANCE THE RESPONSE TO LIVE AND DEAD MARINE MAMMAL STRANDINGS IN OUR CURRENT AND POST-UNUSUAL MORTALITY EVENT (UME) AREA AND CONTINUE TO FULFILL THE RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE NORTH CAROLINA (NC) STRANDING COORDINATOR INCLUDING UPLOADING LEVEL A AND HUMAN AND FISHERIES INTERACTION (HI/FI) DATA FROM OUR NORTH CAROLINA STRANDING PARTNERS (NCSP). WE WILL RESPOND TO LIVE AND RECENTLY STRANDED CETACEANS AND PINNIPEDS IN GOOD CONDITION AS FEASIBLE, COMPLETE DIAGNOSTIC SCREENINGS, PARTICULARLY FOR ANIMALS SUSPECTED TO BE PART OF THE UMES, INCLUDING TRIAGE AND EUTHANASIA AS NECESSARY, INVESTIGATE HUMAN AND FISHERIES INTERACTIONS, COLLECT AND ANALYZE SAMPLES AND DATA, AND SHARE RESULTS WITH COLLEAGUES. WE WILL ASSIST OUR NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STRANDING PARTNERS WHEN NEEDED THROUGHOUT NORTH CAROLINA AND CONTINUE OUTREACH AND STRANDING RESPONSE EFFORTS IN THE REMOTE AREAS OF ALBEMARLE AND PAMLICO SOUNDS TO INCREASE ACCESS TO FRESH STRANDED MARINE MAMMAL CARCASSES, A

PRESCOTT FUNDING WOULD MAKE UP THE DEFICIT IN THE ANNUAL BUDGET FOR MARINE MAMMAL RESCUE, REHABILITATION, AND PUBLIC EDUCATION. FUNDINGS WILL HELP TO MAINTAIN THE LEVEL OF STAFFING THAT HAS INCREASED THE EFFICIENCY OF DAILY OPERATIONS AND WOULD MAKE IT POSSIBLE TO PURCHASE SUPPLIES THAT WOULD NOT OTHERWISE BE WITHIN OUR BUDGET. THIS IS A REGION THAT HAS EXPERIENCED SEVERAL PINNIPED UMES ATTRIBUTED TO INFECTIOUS DISEASE OVER THE PAST TWO DECADES, MAKING IT A PRIORITY AREA FOR IMPROVING CAPACITY FOR RESPONSE, NECROPSY, ANIMAL CARE, AND BIOLOGICAL SAMPLE COLLECTION TO CONTINUE MONITORING FOR INFECTIOUS DISEASE. THIS PROPOSAL WILL FACILITATE THE PURCHASE AND DISTRIBUTION OF A NEXT GENERATION LARGE WHALE ENTANGLEMENT RESPONSE BUOY (SCOUT). SCOUT IS A GAME-CHANGING NEW TRACKING TOOL FOR WHALE ENTANGLEMENT RESPONSE THAT HARNESSES NEXT-GENERATION TECHNOLOGY AND CUTTING-EDGE DESIGN TO IMPROVE OUTCOMES FOR RESPONSE TEAMS, WHALES, AND OCEAN HEALTH. SCOUT INCORPORATES MAJOR ADVANCES IN HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE TECHNOLOGY IN THE FULLY REDESIGNED TRACKING TOOL, RESULTING IN MANY IMPROVEMENTS. THIS TOOL WILL (1) BETTER SUPPORT ENTANGLEMENT RESPONSE TEAMS IN RELOCATING WHALES MORE QUICKLY THROUGH IMPROVED DATA ACCESS, (2) REDUCE THE RISK OF EXACERBATING SERIOUS INJURY AND MORTALITY TO WHALES THROUGH ITS REDUCED DRAG AND DESIGN, AND (3) REDUCE THE SAFETY RISK OF RESPONDERS DEPLOYING THE TAG.

THE OVERALL GOAL OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE THE SERVICE OF RESCUE AND REHABILITATION OF STRANDED MARINE MAMMALS WITHIN THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY, UTILIZING THE STAFF, FACILITIES AND EQUIPMENT OF THE MARINE MAMMAL STRANDING CENTER OF BRIGANTINE. SPECIFICALLY THIS WILL INCLUDE: 1) SUPPORT AND ENHANCE THE BASIC NEEDS AND FACILITY OPERATIONS DIRECTLY RELATED TO THE RESPONSE, CARE, TREATMENT, AND DATA COLLECTION FROM LIVING AND DEAD STRANDED MARINE MAMMALS. 2) ENHANCEMENTS TO THE REHABILITATION FACILITIES AND STRANDING RESPONSE EQUIPMENT TO EXCEED NMFS STANDARDS FOR REHABILITATION FACILITIES 3) INCREASE COMMUNITY OUTREACH EFFORTS IN NEW JERSEY FOCUSED ON INCREASING AWARENESS AND PREVENTING HUMAN INTERACTIONS WITH SEALS.

MAINTAIN FWC-SWFL'S HIGH LEVEL CETACEAN STRANDING RESPONSE, THROUGH CONTINUATION OF A PRESCOTT FUNDED PART-TIME POSITION, SAMPLE ANALYSES, AND NETWORK COORDINATION TO STRANDED CETACEANS IN SOUTHWEST FL AND ENHANCED SUPPORT TO LARGE WHALE, MASS STRANDING AND DISENTANGLEMENT EVENTS THROUGHOUT FL WITH STRONG CONTRIBUTIONS TO NMFS VIA INCREASED CAUSE OF STRANDING AND DEATH DETERMINATIONS.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROPOSED WORK IS TO TEST AND UNDERSTAND THE ABIOTIC AND BIOTIC FACTORS AFFECTING MARINE MAMMAL POSTMORTEM EXAMINATIONS INCLUDING: THE TIMING OF BODY DECOMPOSITION IN MARINE MAMMAL CARCASSES UNDER DIFFERENT ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS, PROVIDE BASELINE DATA ON ANTHROPOGENIC EFFECTS ON CARCASSES, DEMONSTRATE THE EFFECTS OF INVERTEBRATE AND VERTEBRATE SCAVENGERS ON CARCASSES, AND COLLECT AND INTERPRET DATA ON POSTMORTEM INTERVAL TIMING TO ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF MARINE MAMMAL EXAMINATIONS AND INTERPRETATION.

THE GOALS OF THIS PROJECT ARE TO QUANTIFY CARCASS-DISCOVERY RATE (CDR) OF BOTTLENOSE DOLPHINS (TURSIOPS TRUNCATUS) IN ALABAMA, AN UNDERSTUDIED AREA ALONG THE NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO COAST, AND TEST THE USE OF UNOCCUPIED AERIAL SYSTEMS (UASS) AS AN EMERGING TECHNOLOGY TO ENHANCE TRADITIONAL MARINE MAMMAL STRANDING SURVEILLANCE. SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES ARE TO 1) QUANTIFY CDR IN DIFFERENT SEASONS, HABITAT TYPES, AND LEVELS OF HUMAN USE ON DAUPHIN ISLAND, AL TO DETERMINE MULTIPLIERS FOR CALCULATING MORTALITY IN THE STUDY AREA; 2) COMPARE CDR BY THE PUBLIC AND TRAINED STRANDING NETWORK RESPONDERS TO MEASURE THE EFFECT OF FORMAL TRAINING AND TARGETED SEARCH EFFORTS AND EVALUATE THE SUCCESS OF ALMMSN EDUCATION AND OUTREACH EFFORTS; AND 3) FOR TRAINED STRANDING NETWORK RESPONDERS, COMPARE CARCASS-DETECTION RATES BETWEEN TRADITIONAL (E.G. BY FOOT, ATV, AND BOAT) AND UAS METHODS TO QUANTIFY ANY BENEFITS OF USING THIS EMERGING TECHNOLOGY.

THE OVERARCHING GOALS OF THIS PROPOSAL ARE TO IMPROVE COMMUNITY UNDERSTANDING OF MARINE MAMMALS AS WELL AS STRANDING RESCUE RESPONSE, AND TO IMPROVE THE EFFECTIVENESS AND QUALITY OF OUR RESPONSE. MASSACHUSETTS, ESPECIALLY CAPE COD, IS A HOT SPOT FOR MARINE MAMMAL STRANDINGS. HUNDREDS OF SEALS AND CETACEANS STRAND HERE EVERY YEAR. MARINE MAMMAL REHABILITATION HOSPITALS ARE SCARCE IN THE ENTIRE NEW ENGLAND REGION, AND THEREFORE SUFFICIENT SPACE FOR ANIMALS IN NEED OF REHABILITATIVE CARE IS SEVERELY LACKING. PINNIPED STRANDINGS ARE COMMON AND INCREASING, WITH CAUSES RANGING FROM DISEASES AND PREDATION TO HUMAN INTERACTION INCLUDING ENTANGLEMENTS, BOAT STRIKES, PROPELLER CUTS, PLASTIC INGESTION, PROVISIONING, AND PHYSICAL HARASSMENT. THE GOALS OF THIS PROJECT ARE TO 1). SUPPORT THE MISSION OF THE NOAA'S MARINE MAMMAL HEALTH AND STRANDING RESPONSE PROGRAM;  AND 2) TO ENSURE AN INCLUSIVE AND DIVERSE WORK ENVIRONMENT.

THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PRODUCE PILOT DATA FOR AN EPIGENETIC AGING CLOCK FOR PINNIPEDS UTILIZING DNA SAMPLES FROM STRANDED AND FREE-RANGING NORTHERN ELEPHANT SEALS (MIROUNGA ANGUSTIROSTRIS) AS A MODEL TO INVESTIGATE BIOLOGICAL AGE IN THE ENDANGERED HAWAIIAN MONK SEAL (NEOMONACHUS SCHAUINSLANDI). WE AIM TO USE EPIGENETICS TO ASSESS THE PRESENCE OF AGE ACCELERATION - A BIOLOGICAL AGE HIGHER THAN A CHRONOLOGICAL AGE (TIME SINCE BIRTH) PROVIDING AN INDICATION OF BOTH CHRONOLOGICAL AGE AND HEALTH STATUS. WE WILL COMPARE THE DIFFERENCES IN DNA METHYLATION BETWEEN WILD AND REHABILITATED PINNIPEDS TO ASSESS THE IMPACTS OF DEBILITATED HEALTH STATUS. WE HYPOTHESIZE THAT STRANDED ANIMALS WILL HAVE INCREASED BIOLOGICAL AGE DUE TO DISEASES SUCH AS NEMATODE INFESTATION AND MALNUTRITION, PROVIDING AN ADDITIONAL DIAGNOSTIC TOOL TO GUIDE REHABILITATION, CONSERVATION, AND MANAGEMENT DECISIONS.

ENHANCE QUALITY, CONSISTENCY, AND QUANTITY OF STRANDING DATA WITH THE HELP OF ONE PAID SEASONAL STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS. CONDUCT RESEARCH ON INFECTIOUS DISEASES, HARBOR SEAL PUPPING, PARASITES, AND MORE, AND SHARE FINDINGS BY PUBLISHING IN PEER-REVIEWED JOURNALS AND PRESENTING AT REGIONAL CONFERENCES. CONTINUE TO EDUCATE THROUGH PUBLIC OUTREACH PROGRAMS. CONTINUE CURRENT DEI MEASURES AND EXPAND JOB, INTERNSHIP, AND EDUCATION OPPORTUNITIES TO MINORITY GROUPS.

THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THIS ALL-VOLUNTEER GROUP ARE TO BECOME MORE EFFICIENT AS FIRST RESPONDERS IN HUMPBACK WHALE ENTANGLEMENT RESPONSES. DURING THE LAST FULL HUMPBACK WHALE SEASON (2018-2019), OUR GOALS WERE TO REDUCE OUR RESPONSE TIMES ON A CALL-OUT FROM 3 TO 4 HOURS DOWN TO LESS THAN 1 HOUR, FROM RECEIVING THE "GO" ON A RESPONSE CALL, TO THE TIME THAT THE BOATS LEAVES THE DOCK, HEADING OUT TO WHERE THE WHALE IS LOCATED. WE ACHIEVED THOSE GOALS. THE 2019-2020 WHALE SEASON WAS INTERRUPTED BY THE COVID-19 VIRUS, AS WELL AS THE 2020- 2021 WHALE SEASON. THIS YEAR, OUR GOALS ARE TO BECOME MORE PROFICIENT WITH ALL OF OUR EQUIPMENT AND WITH WORKING IN THE DIFFERENT POSITIONS ON THE RESPONSE BOATS, SO THAT IT BECOMES SECOND NATURE FOR ALL OF OUR RESPONDERS.

1.INCREASE RESPONSE TO, AND POSTMORTEM EXAMINATION OF, MARINE MAMMALS STRANDED ALONG EASTERN PUGET SOUND, WASHINGTON, BY CREATING A TRI-ORGANIZATIONAL COLLABORATION THAT WILL FOSTER INCREASED AND IMPROVED DATA COLLECTION, SHARING, AND MANAGEMENT. 2.IMPROVE ORGANIZATIONAL INFRASTRUCTURE OF THE EASTERN PUGET SOUND AREA STRANDING NETWORKS BY FUNDING PART-TIME PAID STAFF POSITIONS, AND EXPANDING THE AREA'S VOLUNTEER BASE AND CAPABILITIES BY PROVIDING VOLUNTEER TRAINING AND SUPPLIES FOR BASIC STRANDING RESPONSE AND LEVEL A DATA COLLECTION, AS WELL AS PARTICIPATION OF STAFF MEMBERS AND KEY VOLUNTEERS FROM EACH OF THE THREE GROUPS IN ADVANCED STRANDING RESPONSE AND SAMPLING TRAINING.

THE ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND GAME, MARINE MAMMAL PROGRAM PROPOSAL, CONSISTS OF TWO PROGRAMS WITH MULTIPLE PROJECTS. FISH AND GAME HAS CONDUCTED STUDIES FOR MORE THAN 60 YEARS, FROM WHICH IMPORTANT BASELINE DATASETS ON THE BIOLOGY, POPULATION AND ECOLOGY OF ALASKA'S MARINE MAMMALS HAVE BEEN DEVELOPED AND USED TO INFORM MANAGEMENT. SPECIFICALLY, CRITICAL INFORMATION REQUIRED TO BETTER UNDERSTAND HOW COMMERCIAL FISHERIES, PREDATION, OIL AND GAS ACTIVITIES, AND ENVIRONMENTAL VARIABILITY (I.E., REGIME SHIFTS AND CLIMATE CHANGE) INFLUENCE MARINE MAMMAL POPULATIONS, INCLUDING THOSE LISTED UNDER THE ENDANGERED SPECIES ACT. ADF&G FIRST RECEIVED FUNDING FROM THE NATIONAL MARINE FISHERIES SERVICE IN THE MID-1980S, TO INVESTIGATE MARINE MAMMAL-FISHERIES INTERACTIONS. OVER THE NEXT THREE DECADES, FISH AND GAME HAS APPLIED FISHERIES FUNDING TO PROJECTS THAT SUBSTANTIALLY CONTRIBUTE TO THE MANAGEMENT AND CONSERVATION OF MARINE MAMMALS THROUGHOUT ALASKA; MANY PROJECTS ARE CONDUCTED IN DIRECT

PROJECT OBJECTIVES:    THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS ESSENTIAL STAFFING NEEDS TO MAINTAIN AND EXPAND THE STRANDING RESPONSE PROGRAM IN DELAWARE, AND INCLUDES THE CRITICAL ROLE OF THE STRANDING COORDINATOR'S POSITION AND A NEW POSITION FOR A STRANDING TECHNICIAN, WHICH WILL ENABLE US TO MAXIMIZE OUR CURRENT STRANDING RESPONSE CAPABILITIES, AND WILL HELP US TO MEET THE GROWING DEMANDS OF SEAL RESPONSE, INCLUDING THOSE DEMANDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE EMERGING TREND OF SEAL PUPPING ALONG THE DELAWARE COAST, AND THE SUBSEQUENT CARE AND SHORT TERM HOLDING REQUIRED FOR DEPENDENT AND WEANLING PUPS.    SURVEILLANCE MONITORING OF THE EMERGING SEAL COLONY OFF OF DELAWARE WILL HELP TO DOCUMENT ACTIVITY PERTAINING TO SPECIES, PUPPING, AND HEALTH DATA.    THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE COST OF THE 24 HOUR REPORTING HOTLINE AND CELL PHONE COVERAGE, WHICH WILL FACILITATE COMMUNICATION DURING STRANDING EVENTS AND GENERAL OPERATIONS. MARINE MAMMALS OF MAINE RESPONDS TO STRANDED PINNIPEDS AND CETACEANS IN MID-COAST AND SOUTHERN MAINE AND PROVIDES TRIAGE AND REHABILITATION SERVICES FOR PINNIPEDS IN NEED OF SHORT- AND LONG-TERM CARE THAT STRAND THROUGHOUT THE NORTHEAST US. THIS IS A REGION THAT FACES SEVERAL ONGOING LARGE WHALE UNUSUAL MORTALITY EVENTS (UMES) AND RECENTLY EXPERIENCED A PINNIPED UME, MAKING IT A PRIORITY AREA FOR IMPROVING CAPACITY FOR RESPONSE, NECROPSY, AND ANIMAL CARE. WE SEEK FUNDS TO SUPPORT INCREASED PINNIPED REHABILITATION CAPACITY THROUGH THE PURCHASE OF NEW SUPPLIES AND MINOR STRUCTURAL MODIFICATIONS RECOMMENDED DURING A RECENT NMFS INSPECTION. FUNDS ARE ALSO REQUESTED TO SUPPORT ONGOING OPERATIONAL COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH HIGH QUALITY RESPONSE TO AND DATA COLLECTION FROM LIVE AND DEAD STRANDED MARINE MAMMALS. WE ARE COMMITTED TO BROADENING PARTICIPATION IN THE MARINE MAMMAL FIELD THROUGH A SUMMER INTERNSHIP PROGRAM THAT PROVIDES TRAINING IN MARINE MAMMAL STRANDING RESPONSE, EDUCATION AND OUTREA

THE PROJECT OBJECTIVE(S) IS TO PROVIDE STRANDING RESPONSE CAPACITY FOR THE SOUTH CAROLINA MARINE MAMMAL STRANDING NETWORK (SCMMSN) AND INCREASE AWARENESS ABOUT MARINE MAMMALS IN SOUTH CAROLINA. AFTER A TWO YEAR TRANSITION OF THE OVERSIGHT OF THE SCMMSN FROM COASTAL CAROLINA UNIVERSITY (CCU) TO THE LOWCOUNTRY MARINE MAMMAL NETWORK (LMMN), THE OBJECTIVES IN THIS PROPOSAL WILL BE EXECUTED BY LMMN IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE'S CENTER FOR COASTAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH AND BIOMEDICAL RESEARCH (NOS/CCEHBR). FUNDING IS REQUESTED FOR LMMN FOR: (1) PERSONNEL AND LOGISTICS REQUIRED FOR STRANDING RESPONSE, TISSUE COLLECTION, AND EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT PROPOSAL IS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR CRITICAL OPERATIONAL NEEDS OF THE TEXAS MARINE MAMMAL STRANDING NETWORK (TMMSN) FOR RESPONSE, TREATMENT, AND DATA COLLECTION FROM STRANDED MARINE MAMMALS ALONG THE TEXAS COASTLINE. BY MEANS OF THE CONTINUED OPERATION OF TMMSN AND SUPPORT FOR STRANDING RESPONSE PERSONNEL, DEAD MARINE MAMMALS WILL BE SWIFTLY RECOVERED AND NECROPSIED WITH LEVEL A, B, AND C DATA COLLECTED, INCLUDING THE DETECTION OF EMERGING DISEASE AND UNUSUAL FINDINGS, ACCORDING TO DECOMPOSITION. THE INCIDENCE OF HUMAN AND FISHERIES INTERACTION WILL BE WELL DOCUMENTED AND REPORTED. TMMSN WILL SUPPORT DISENTANGLEMENT EFFORTS AND INCREASE OUT-OF-HABITAT RESPONSE CAPACITY IN TEXAS AND LOUISIANA AS REQUESTED. LIVE STRANDED MARINE MAMMALS WILL RECEIVE A VETERINARY HEALTH ASSESSMENT, DIAGNOSTIC SCREENING FOR HIGH PRIORITY PATHOGENS, AND CARE IN REHABILITATION OR HUMANE EUTHANASIA.

IN COLLABORATION WITH MARINE MAMMALS OF MAINE, WE SEEK FUNDS TO ANALYZE BIOLOGICAL SAMPLES COLLECTED PRIOR TO, DURING, AND FOLLOWING THE RECENT PINNIPED UNUSUAL MORTALITY EVENT (UME) IN THE NORTHEAST US. THIS UME, WHICH RESULTED FROM AN OUTBREAK OF PHOCINE DISTEMPER VIRUS (PDV), IMPACTED PRIMARILY HARBOR SEALS AND TO A LESSER EXTENT GRAY AND HARP SEALS, MIRRORING TRENDS OBSERVED IN PREVIOUS PHOCINE DISTEMPER AND AVIAN INFLUENZA VIRUS OUTBREAKS IN PINNIPED POPULATIONS ACROSS THE NORTH ATLANTIC. OUR ANALYSES AIM TO IMPROVE OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE DIFFERENTIAL IMPACT OF INFECTIOUS DISEASES ACROSS PINNIPED SPECIES AND THEREBY INFORM EFFECTIVE RESPONSE TO FUTURE UMES.

TO MAINTAIN MARINE MAMMAL STRANDING RESPONSE IN DOWNEAST MAINE THROUGH CONTINUED EMPLOYMENT OF KEY RESPONSE PERSONNEL AND PURCHASE OF SUPPLIES, THUS ENABLING AN EFFECTIVE AND HUMANE SCIENCE-BASED PROGRAM THAT INCLUDES RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT, TRAINING, DATA COLLECTION AND EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH.

PAUL ISLAND.
